intro: Botrychium kannenbergii f. simplex, commonly known as the simple moonwort, is a fern belonging to the family Ophioglossaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single, narrow, lance-shaped sterile frond and a separate, small fertile frond. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its spore-producing structures are located on the underside of the fertile frond. Botrychium kannenbergii f. simplex is a rare and often overlooked species, with limited geographic distribution.
